intro: Aeschynomene hedysaroides, commonly known as the partridge pea, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a legume, belonging to the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, disturbed soils and is often used for forage and erosion control. It has a deep root system that helps it thrive in poor soil conditions.
